Gin Spritz

Added by apartmentcooker
513 Views | 2 Comments
  • Save Recipe 8
  • Pin It
  • Tweet
  • Community Pick!
  • This recipe was entered in the contest for Your Best Poolside Cocktail
  • This recipe was entered in the contest for Your Best Spring Refresher

Recipe Notes

  • A&M's  Testing Notes:

    Mint, lime juice, gin and bubbles. There is little more that I want in a grown-up summer cocktail. The mint complements the herbal qualities in the gin and the Prosecco lightens the drink...

    Mint, lime juice, gin and bubbles. There is little more that I want in a grown-up summer cocktail. The mint complements the herbal qualities in the gin and the Prosecco lightens the drink, making it go down really easily. - Emily

    More » « Less

  • apartmentcooker's Notes:

    This is inspired by a cocktail I had at Gigis' Trattoria in Rhinebeck, NY. It's deliciously refreshing - awesome for drinking outside! - apartmentcooker

Recipe

This recipe serves 1

  • juice of one lime

    Ask a question about this ingredient

  • 4-6 mint leaves

    Ask a question about this ingredient

  • 1 tbsp sugar

    Ask a question about this ingredient

  • 1 shot gin

    Ask a question about this ingredient

  • prosecco

    Ask a question about this ingredient

  1. Muddle the lime, mint, and sugar together. Transfer to a cocktail shaker with ice and the gin. Shake until chilled.

    Ask a question about this step

  2. Pour into a chilled glass and finish with prosecco.

    Ask a question about this step
Tags: cocktails, Drinks, gin
